section: A. Recipient wishes to engage the Vendor to provide certain services and resources (the "Deliverables") and Provider desires to provide Recipient with the Services all in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.
explanation: The Recitals section introduces the term "Vendor" and states that Recipient wishes to engage the Vendor. However, the rest of the agreement refers to the service provider as "Provider", not "Vendor". This creates confusion because it is not clear if "Vendor" and "Provider" are supposed to be the same entity. This introduces ambiguity as to which party is responsible for providing the services.

section: 1.2 Standard of Service. (b) Supplier shall maintain complete and accurate records relating to the provision of the Services under this Agreement, in such form as Recipient shall approve.
explanation: The 'Standard of Service' section mentions "Supplier" instead of "Provider," creating confusion and misalignment. It's not explicitly clear whether 'Supplier' refers to the same entity as 'Provider,' leading to uncertainty about who is responsible for maintaining the required records.

section: 3.1 Termination of Agreement. This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: This section has structural flaws that make it difficult to read and understand. The text states "This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020". The word "Agreement" shows up twice and the sentence structure makes no sense.
